alert.note: Alert for Guam; Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 03 at 6:06PM ChST until January 04 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CHST TUESDAY... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 8 to 10 feet tonight decreasing to 7 to 9 feet Tuesday along north facing reefs. Dangerous rip currents along north facing reefs through Tuesday afternoon and east facing reefs through Friday. * WHERE...North and east facing reefs of the Marianas. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 PM ChST Tuesday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
